chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Gregory S. Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent include AODA/treatment.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory S. Harris in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 2-4:
24 months Probation; May serve probation in Illinois
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute Sobriety of alcohol or drug paraphernalia
Random UAs
No taverns/liquor stores that primary sale is alcohol or drug paraphernalia
$443.00 x 3  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION) 

Count 5:
10 days SCJ, w/huber privileges, consecutive.  Comm. on or before Nov. 8, 2014 @ 6:00 pm
$443.00 C/C, 60 days to pay or payment plan - BOND APPLY HERE FIRST
4 days credit
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Gregory S. Harris in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NCP entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Deferred Prosecution Ordered 24 mos. on Ct. 1; Filed agreement.
Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading
Defendant Gregory S. Harris in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory S. Harris in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Guerard would like to further discuss resolution with ADA Newton.  State does not object.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on June 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory S. Harris in court with attorney .  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney has received an offer.  Likely to resolve.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Return date on May 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gregory S. Harris appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not qualify.  State request $1000.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  Resides in IL.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Attorney Steinman advises address is correct.  No missed court or warrants.  Advised rights to an attorney.   Time limits waived.  $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
